pr_title: MULE-18906: Watermark in polling sources is updated when source is stopping.

timeline.bodyText:
Comment from @Bardammu :
"We can try to retrieve all the values of recentlyProcessedIds and then call contains for each key. In this way, we avoid making a request for each key to OSv2.
Not in this PR, it's something we should think about."
timeline.author: SebaElizalde

timeline.bodyText: Why are these changes necesary? Can't we just skip this step if the source is stopping?
timeline.author: ndinu

timeline.bodyText: where does the need of doing this comes from? I though that if the source was stopping we could skip this.
timeline.author: ndinu

timeline.bodyText: Should the default for this mean, never await? so that we do not affect existing tests.
timeline.author: ndinu

replies.bodyText: 0 means never wait, I can set it to -1 to be more clear. Or start the count from 0 (that would be the first item) and make -1 default.
replies.author: SebaElizalde

replies.bodyText: 👍 I think it is ok the way it is.
replies.author: ndinu

timeline.bodyText: Use constants for timeout and frequency
timeline.author: ndinu
